thread.title: Schools and Parents Fight a Juul E-Cigarette Epidemic

author: Anne Marie Chaker
title: Schools and Parents Fight a Juul E-Cigarette Epidemic
text:
At Northern High School in Dillsburg, Pa., Principal Steve Lehmanâ€™s locked safe, which once contained the occasional pack of confiscated cigarettes, is now filled with around 40 devices that look like flash drives.

The device is called a Juul and it is a type of e-cigarette that delivers a powerful dose of nicotine, derived from tobacco, in a patented salt solution that smokers say closely mimics the feeling of inhaling cigarettes. It has become a coveted teen status symbol and a growing problem in high schools and middle... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
